definition: to have a show-down/to fight for mastery/to compete for a championship
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly
female/Taiwan pr. [ci1]
male/staminate/grand/imposing/powerful/mighty/person or state having great power and influence

sentences.english: The two teams are getting ready for a final showdown.
sentences.chinese: 意思是这两支球队正准备一决雌雄。

sentences.english: Would like to put on their spacesuits mighty showdown?
sentences.chinese: 想穿上威武太空服与他们一决雌雄？

sentences.english: There's bound to be a showdown between these two rivals.
sentences.chinese: 这两个对手最后肯定要一决雌雄。

sentences.english: They decided to settle the argument with a race.
sentences.chinese: 于是他们决定通过比赛来一决雌雄。

sentences.english: The stage seemed set for a showdown.
sentences.chinese: 这样的舞台好像就是为了一决雌雄而准备的。

sentences.english: Earth had prepared for a showdown, building the greatest armada of all time .
sentences.chinese: 地球建造了历来最庞大的太空舰队准备一决雌雄。

definition: see 一決雌雄|一决雌雄[yi1 jue2 ci2 xiong2]
to contend for supremacy
lit. to meet face to face on a narrow path (idiom)/fig. enemies or rivals meet face to face
to strive
to meet on the battlefield (idiom)
to contend for hegemony/a power struggle
lit. you die, I live (idiom); irreconcilable adversaries/two parties cannot coexist
to challenge an opponent to a fight
to whom the deer falls (idiom); the one to emerge victor (i.e. to seize the empire)/prize winner/champion
decisive battle/to fight a decisive battle/to fight for supremacy in ...
to collaborate/to join forces/to effect a junction
contend against
to fight/to exchange blows
a tie-break/to determine the winner
lit. to proclaim oneself hegemon/to take a leading role/to build a personal fiefdom
peer competition/to function as rivals/to make claims as an equal
